c:atomType.name: TooltipGravity
c:atomType.c:documentation:
The gravity of the tooltip controls where the tooltip is place relative to the visual element's anchor point.
The gravity is the tooltip's corner or side that is placed at the visual element's anchor point.
Said in yet another way: «Gravity is the direction of the tooltip arrow. The arrow points to the target element.»
The following diagram illustrates the tooltip arrow anchor points.
When is true, the "crossed" gravities are really at the tooltip box corners.
nw n ne +-o----o----o-+ | | w o Tooltip o e | | +-o----o----o-+ sw s se

c:atom.name: South
c:atom.c:documentation: Bottom tooltip side is placed at the visual element's anchor point, resulting in the tooltip being above it.

c:atom.name: North
c:atom.c:documentation: Top tooltip side is placed at the visual element's anchor point, resulting in the tooltip being below it.

c:atom.name: East
c:atom.c:documentation: Right tooltip side is placed at the visual element's anchor point, resulting in the tooltip being at its left.

c:atom.name: West
c:atom.c:documentation: Left tooltip side is placed at the visual element's anchor point, resulting in the tooltip being at its right.

c:atom.name: NorthWest
c:atom.c:documentation: Upper-left tooltip corner is placed at the visual element's anchor point, resulting in the tooltip being below it and at its right.

c:atom.name: NorthEast
c:atom.c:documentation: Upper-right tooltip corner is placed at the visual element's anchor point, resulting in the tooltip being below it and at its left.

c:atom.name: SouthWest
c:atom.c:documentation: Lower-left tooltip corner is placed at the visual element's anchor point, resulting in the tooltip being above it and at its right.

c:atom.name: SouthEast
c:atom.c:documentation: Lower-right tooltip corner is placed at the visual element's anchor point, resulting in the tooltip being above it and at its left.
